passage: After the printing press was introduced in 1440, handwritten manuscripts from Europe's medieval period were often destroyed and the paper used for other purposes. In one instance, pages ______ blank a collection of Norse tales dating to 1270 were discovered lining a bishop's miter (hat).
question_text: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

answer_rationales.C: Choice C is the best answer. The word "from" introduces a prepositional phrase that modifies the noun "pages" and provides essential information about their origin. No additional punctuation is needed after "from" in this context.
answer_rationales.A: Choice A is incorrect. This choice results in a punctuation error, illogically separating the preposition "from" from the rest of the prepositional phrase with a colon. Also, a colon can only follow an independent clause, but what comes before the blank could not stand on its own as a complete sentence.
answer_rationales.B: Choice B is incorrect. This choice results in a punctuation error, illogically separating the preposition "from" from the rest of the prepositional phrase with a comma.
answer_rationales.D: Choice D is incorrect. This choice results in a punctuation error, illogically separating the preposition "from" from the rest of the prepositional phrase with a dash.
